sub_title: Partnership & Web3 Ecosystem at AllianceBlock & Web3 educator International Creative Business program in Utrecht (Bachelor & Master)
summary:
The world we live in excites me; the creator economy in Web3 allows for completely new ways of engagement between creators and fans. Web3 allows us to create infinite models versus the standard finite models we know from Web2. Web3 allows us to build micro-economies where many stakeholders are connected, versus the 1-1 models we know of in Web2. Developments around AI, blockchain, Solid and robotics are just a few of the innovation areas of my interest.

Besides my professional career, I love exploring the world around us. I love nature, good food, cooking, travelling and meeting new people with a diversity of perspectives and opinions. I consider myself an ambivert as I love being at home with the cats and my partner and I am also happy to be on stage presenting for large audiences.

I have co-developed and coordinated the world's first Web3-business-model course for the Creative Industries at University level. When I started the course back mid-2018, there were very few people talking about Web3, let alone building new business models using Web3 technologies. In this role, I have had the opportunity to 'always try to stay ahead of the curve'. When people were talking about crypto, I was talking about Web3, when the industry started to understand blockchain principles, I was explaining NFTs and the decentralised metaverse, and when creative companies started exploring x2e models, I trained students on how to think beyond that.

I foresee that more and more companies in the creative industries and platform economies will start to understand that the power of Web3 lies in the ability to create infinite worlds, to create micro-economies. At the moment, too many businesses take-on an x2e approach, which in the end will not be sustainable. The thinking needs to shift from temporary projects to long lasting micro-economies, those who can build that, will exist in the future.

treasury_media.title: Creative Business & Blockchain series- Part one- Blockchain & Creative pains
treasury_media.description: My second article (view on slideshare) about the Creative Business & Blockchain. In this part I introduce some major creative pains and I show how digital assets on the Smart Web could work. It is a start of a deep-dive, and should give some insights about new business opportunities. Starting point is the realisation that blockchain is a service, not a solution.

awards.title: Lecturer of the year of my department

projects.title: Smart Music: Copyright Delta X Bitfury Surround X Elastos
projects.description:
Late 2018 I first got involved in one of the most exciting Music projects I have seen so far. The team is building a new Smart Music Economy which will add great value to the music industry and is now (Feb 2020) close to launch. 

The combination of a Bitcoin secured Operating Environment (elastOS) and grassroots movement with the businesses Copyright Delta and the Bitcoin powered permissioned blockchain of Bitfury Surround is absolutely outstanding and unique in the Creative Industries. Just imagine being able to securely enjoy your music (elastOS is a new web) knowing that copyright is handled for you in a fair way and that artist enjoy speedy payments. Regardless of wether you enjoy the music in 2D, AR or VR and if it is a live show or a recording of musical work. 

My role is solely as an Elastos community member and is done out of passion for the music industry and the new web. I have spent hundreds of hours learning and doing while exploring the Smart Music industry.

contributors.headline: Partnership & Web3 Ecosystem at AllianceBlock & Web3 educator International Creative Business program in Utrecht (Bachelor & Master)

projects.title: Launch of the first semester of a new curriculum
projects.description:
At first I was part of a workgroup responsible for the development of the first year of the communication course within the School of Design and Communication. In November I was promoted to the position of semester coordinator making me co-responsible for the project management and the launch of the first semester. As a project manager/semester coordinator I was a linking pin for this project in the steering committee.

My responsibilities included:
•	Coordinate the work of workgroups
•	Ensure high quality standards
•	Maintain cohesiveness between workgroups
•	Develop and deliver presentations for several stakeholders
•	Develop improvement plans for future semesters for management
•	Provide vision and leadership to team leads and lecturers
•	Review and approve deliverables

contributors.headline: Partnership & Web3 Ecosystem at AllianceBlock & Web3 educator International Creative Business program in Utrecht (Bachelor & Master)

projects.title: Project manager business plan
projects.description: This was my first project management position at the Amsterdam School of Economics. I was responsible for a six-month project where students had to deliver a business plan. In this position I provided leadership to students and lecturers and I ensured high quality standards. I gave several presentations for up to three hundred students and lecturers, and I created several trainings ranging from creativity trainings to marketing trainings. I have been responsible for this project two times between August 2011 and February 2013.

profile_positions.description:
AllianceBlock is an infrastructure provider for decentralized tokenized markets. We empower businesses with liquidity provisioning and allow them to compliantly issue, manage, and trade tokenized, digital assets including real-world assets (RWAs).

The AllianceBlock ecosystem of partners, clients, and ventures consists of top stakeholders from the financial industry, as well as the decentralized finance (DeFi) sector. Our unique product suite complies with global regulations and seamlessly integrates with legacy systems.

In my role as 'Partnership and Ecosystem manager' I am happy to connect with companies that are looking to tokenize their Real World Assets and dApps or Blockchains (L1/L2) that would benefit from our solutions (this is all of you). Our Nexera protocol enables many new routes for growth and I am happy to explore with you what that might look like for you.

Connect with me to schedule a call.
profile_positions.title: Partnership & Web3 Ecosystem at AllianceBlock

profile_positions.company: HU University of Applied Sciences Utrecht (Hogeschool Utrecht)
profile_positions.description:
I have co-developed and coordinated the world's first Web3-business-model course for the Creative Industries at University level. When I started the course back mid-2018, there were very few people talking about Web3, let alone building new business models using Web3 technologies. In this role, I have had the opportunity to 'always try to stay ahead of the curve'. When people were talking about crypto, I was talking about Web3, when the industry started to understand blockchain principles, I was explaining NFTs and the decentralised metaverse, and when creative companies started exploring x2e models, I trained students on how to think beyond that.

I foresee that more and more companies in the creative industries and platform economies will start to understand that the power of Web3 lies in the ability to create infinite worlds, to create micro-economies. At the moment, too many businesses take-on an x2e approach, which in the end will not be sustainable. The thinking needs to shift from temporary projects to long lasting micro-economies, those who can build that, will exist in the future. I have trained over 500 international Creative Business professionals to think strategically and in a way that fits the ultimate purpose of Web3.

Other topics I teach include Growth Hacking, Marketing and Strategic Brand Building related courses.
profile_positions.title: Education Professional (focus on Web3 and marketing)

profile_positions.company: HU University of Applied Sciences Utrecht (Hogeschool Utrecht)
profile_positions.description:
With a great global team of Creative Business professionals (over 80 people) we continuously innovate our education. It is my pleasure to act as a “Team Lead” (up to 18 fte.) and I take it as my role to facilitate and drive the innovation that our education and the Creative Business industry needs. 

We offer a range of courses (on Bachelor and Master level) aimed at the crossover between Technology, Humanities, Business and Creative Strategy. Courses we teach are about Circular Innovation, AI & Creativity and Blockchain driven Business models to name a few.

With my team, we take education where it has not gone before, offering the most up to date programme to our students. I am happy to connect with (global) potential clients to work with in our education.
profile_positions.title: Team Lead Creative Business

profile_positions.company: HU University of Applied Sciences Utrecht (Hogeschool Utrecht)
profile_positions.description:
As Head of Marketing of our international bachelor degree Creative Business, I was responsible for a whole range of marketing related tasks. We attract students, high-level academics and practitioners, clients and partner universities from every corner of the world. We are unique in our global approach.

We innovate at the same speed we are used to in the Creative Business which can be seen in our programme. One of my challenges is to make sure that we continuously build state-of-the-art marketing and marketing communication courses that prepare our international students for a successful career in the International Creative Business.

To reach those goals we go where no Creative Business programme has gone before. We touch upon the most topical subjects and we are changing our educational system from “traditional”, where the lecturer is the main source of inspiration and content, to a forward thinking organisation where inspiration comes from anywhere in the world.

I am happy to connect with professionals from the Creative Business worldwide. We work together with many partners, from AI or Blockchain startups to industry giants and I am happy to connect with anyone interested in doing great things together with our University.
profile_positions.title: Head Of Marketing

profile_positions.description:
Cordial World is an NL based foundation that is building a Web3 platform for data-dignity, monetisation and knowledge sharing. When we consider every single person to be an expert at something, then communities can be formed around knowledge-tasks (ex. a government that wants to poll political views), and new insight creation. Communities that create new insights together can then add that anonymised data to a Web3 data-trust, which in turn allows them to earn from past work done.

This enables a 'knowledge creator economy'.
profile_positions.title: Strategic Advisor

profile_positions.description: After being active in the Blockchain industry for 3+ years I co-founded the Cordial World Foundation, supported by brilliant advisors from across the world and by a passionate community. Connect with me for partnerships and for Cordial Operations.
profile_positions.title: Co-Founder & Board Member

profile_positions.description:
Copyright Delta builds services that, at its core, allow music rights holders to control and manage their data and rights in their own blockchain vaults. This puts rights holders in full control and allows us to offer two ground breaking services that solve some of the big challenges/pains in the industry. 

First, this allows the user to safely distribute content to Web3 creating new revenue streams with instant royalty monitoring and processing. This is ground breaking and directly solves copyright challenges in the Web3 space. To put it simply, Web3 economies that want to include music in their projects depend on Copyright Delta for copyright cleared content. This is a clear win-win-win scenario where all benefit.

Second, we have built tools to do analytics and forensics for royalty statements. This allows us to, quite literally, find your missing money. This is unique in the music-streaming industry and gives value where it belongs.
profile_positions.title: Creative Business advisor

profile_positions.description:
The Orchard Creative initiative consisted of a group of experts from various professional backgrounds and nationalities. Together with technical blockchain experts, entrepreneurs, academics and thought leaders we trained and educated companies, platforms and NGOs on anything related to Web3.

In this role I contributed to the white-paper of a large DAO (2018) and I have been a council member for appr. two years (voted by the community). As a Creative Business expert my focus has always been on Web3 business models and helping companies understand the power of Web3.
profile_positions.title: Co-Founder

profile_positions.description:
I helped various businesses grow their brand in Perth, Western Australia and I continued the work in The Netherlands.
Together with clients we build brand identities that resonate internally and externally. I then help clients root their Brand Identity in their Growth Hacking strategy, content marketing and product launch.
Clients I advised range from the creative industries to FMCG.
profile_positions.title: Marketing Consultant

profile_positions.description: In this senior position I coordinated a team of over forty marketing and media lecturers in the disciplines marketing (communication), entrepreneurship, brand design, project management and governance, I also lectured these disciplines. Due to my outstanding results I was promoted to this senior position and the highlight of my tenure was when I received the ‘Lecturer of the year’ award in 2013.
profile_positions.title: Senior lecturer, Amsterdam University of Applied Science

profile_positions.description: I have been part of a project team assigned to a loyalty program for an international client in the automotive industry. In my daily chores I worked on several elements of the campaign and I had both internal and external clients. I enjoyed working towards tight deadlines and I excelled at my coordinating tasks.
profile_positions.title: Project manager

profile_positions.description: As a product marketer, which was a position for young professionals, I worked on all marketing activities within the product life cycle of assigned products. Consequently I have worked on both strategic and tactical levels and I have worked on all aspects of the marketing mix. My responsibilities included new product development and launch, management and monitoring of European promotional campaigns, coordination and motivation of representatives in local sales offices and aligning tasks with internal and external suppliers.
profile_positions.title: Product Manager and Process Manager

volunteer_experiences.description:
As a passionate capoeira practitioner, volunteer and later capoeira teacher. I have travelled the world to join capoeira events and shows. Due to a (non-capoeira related) injury, I had to decide to spend less time on my sports.

I have have run my own capoeira school in Australia and taught capoeira to all ages. I have organised my own events and I have travelled to many different places in Europe, Brazil and beyond. I am grateful to this sport, as it taught me a many valuable life lessons and I am happy I managed to pass on my knowledge to others.
